IX.iii.1.D.4.a
.
Applying the End-of-the-Month Rule to Reductions and Discontinuances
The end-of-the-month rule applies to Parents’ DIC reductions and discontinuances because of increases in income, per
38 CFR 3.660(a)(2)
.  However, income is still counted on a calendar year basis.  It is not annualized like Improved Pension income.  This means that for Parents’ DIC, income is often not counted for a full 12 months.
The end-of-the-month rule was made applicable to Parents’ DIC cases by
PL 95-588
which was effective January 1, 1979.  Prior to January 1, 1979, the end-of-the-year rule applied to Parents’ DIC.
Note
:  Although
38 CFR 3.660(a)(2)
states that such reductions and discontinuances are effective the end of the month (called the “end-of-the-month rule”), VA pays benefits through that last day and therefore the actual date of reduction or discontinuance (“no-pay” date) is the first day of the following month.
